english: three-stringed Chinese lute used in Pingtan

etymology.interpretation: The word 三弦(三弦) (sānxián, "three-stringed lute") refers to a traditional Chinese musical instrument with three strings. It is often used in the storytelling art form known as Pingtan, popular in the Jiangsu and Zhejiang provinces.

examples.chinese: 他听三弦的旋律陶醉(他聽三弦的旋律陶醉)。
examples.pinyin: Tā tīng sānxián de xuànlǜ táozuì.
examples.english: He becomes enchanted by the melody of the three-stringed lute.

examples.chinese: 在评弹表演中(在評彈表演中)，艺人弹奏三弦伴奏(藝人彈奏三弦伴奏)。
examples.pinyin: Zài píngtán biǎoyǎn zhōng, yìrén dànzòu sānxián bànzòu.
examples.english: During the Pingtan performance, the artist plays the three-stringed lute to accompany the show.

examples.chinese: 古时的文人常以三弦为乐器(古時的文人常以三弦為樂器)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔshí de wénrén cháng yǐ sānxián wéi yuèqì.
examples.english: In ancient times, scholars often used the three-stringed lute as a musical instrument.
